title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Goldman Sachs said its second-quarter profit fell 47%, capping an earnings season where weak and volatile markets crimped investment-banking revenue, but boosted trading.

Bank of America's quarterly profit fell 32%, but revenue rose on strong consumer spending and borrowing.

---

Rising interest rates are braking a global housing boom, heaping more pressure on central banks trying to tame inflation without triggering downturns in national economies.

---

Delta said it was ordering 100 of Boeing's largest 737 MAX jets, adding to the list of big U.S. carriers operating the airliner.

---

U.S. stocks fell, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq both retreating 0.8% and the Dow shedding 0.7%.

---

Hulu has emerged as Walt Disney's fastest-growing U.S. streaming service, outstripping even the flagship Disney+.

---

Twitter called Elon Musk's opposition to a speedy trial for its case against the billionaire a "tactical delay."

---

Christie's said it is starting its own in-house investing firm to seed tech startups geared to facilitating art purchases and sales.

---

GE Vernova will be the name of General Electric's power business when it splits from the company in 2024.

---

IBM reported quarterly sales and earnings per share that surpassed Wall Street's expectations.
